title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 639.1 - Reimbursement for other assistance
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 639.1 - Reimbursement for other assistance

State Regulations
(a) Claims for reimbursement for assistance
or benefits, not subject to the provisions of Parts 620 through 638 of this

Title, provided to recipients of assistance and care or other eligible
individuals, shall be claimed for reimbursement on schedules and formats
prescribed by the department and in accordance with instructions of the
department. However, the department shall not be precluded from accepting
claims for reimbursement in a format which deviates from such instructions, if
any, of the department. Amounts subject to reimbursement shall be claimed in
accordance with State and Federal law and regulation, and unless otherwise
specifically directed by the department, shall be claimed in a manner that
results in the greatest proportion of Federal participation or alternatively
shall be claimed in a manner that does not increase the amount of State
reimbursement which would be available if Federal participation were
available. (b) Expenditures made by
social services districts for assistance, benefits provided to recipients of
assistance and care or other eligible individuals or entities, shall be subject
to reimbursement by the State in accordance with applicable State law and
department directives and instructions pertaining thereto. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
639.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
